diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: Patient presented with 1 day of abdominal pain that migrated from the periumbilical area to the right lower quadrant, which is characteristic of acute appendicitis. The physical exam showed tenderness in the right lower quadrant with mild rebound tenderness. CT results indicated that the appendix was mildly enlarged at 8 mm with hazy increased attenuation in the adjacent fat and hypervascularity, supporting the diagnosis of appendicitis.
